meanings.definition: (adjective) existing simultaneously with and usually independently of another medical condition
meanings.sent1: The patient was diagnosed with diabetes and hypertension, which are comorbid conditions.
meanings.sent2: It is common for obesity to be comorbid with heart disease.
meanings.sent3: The comorbid relationship between allergies and asthma can be quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her stress and anxiety seemed comorbid, each feeding off the other.
meanings.sent5: The comorbid nature of depression and insomnia made it difficult for him to sleep.

meanings.definition: (verb) to have two or more medical conditions at the same time
meanings.sent1: She comorbid diabetes and high cholesterol, requiring careful management.
meanings.sent2: As she aged, she began to comorbid various health issues.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that he seemed to comorbid every illness in the book.
meanings.sent4: His decision to smoke and not exercise comorbid his risk factors for heart disease.
meanings.sent5: The tendency to comorbid multiple conditions can complicate treatment plans.
